On Fri, 27 Jun 2003, Gordon Mohr wrote:

|Parker writes:
|> Worth noting, both were run from the same source (compiled on different 
|> machines) and on the same pages, however the files differ in size by 6 
|> bytes.  I did not look into why this was the case.
|
|I've noticed a 1-byte discrepancy on sets that should be identical as well.
|It's most likely an issue with flushing/properly closing the output
|streams. 
|
|Could you investigate and resolve this?

Looks like this varies by a few bytes because crawls are run at different
times, which produces different Date lines.  This doesn't affect the
uncompressed size, since all chars are 8-bits, but does affect the
compressed size, since compression rates differ based on char frequency.

So, it's not a bug, it's a feature ;).

pt.
--
Parker Thompson
The Internet Archive
